definition: to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

sentences.english: The monarch was ousted by a military coup.
sentences.chinese: 那君主被軍事政變者廢黜了。

sentences.english: Like a king in exile, uncrowned in the underworld.
sentences.chinese: 像流放中的君王，被廢黜到地獄。

sentences.english: The emperor attempted to depose the Pope.
How some have been deposed, some slain in war.
sentences.chinese: 有些被廢黜，有些戰死沙場。

sentences.english: The king was deposed by the revolution.
Tennessee's rescinded manual appeared to confuse lethal injection with electrocution.
sentences.chinese: 田納西廢黜的手冊似乎是將致命注射和電刑混爲一談。

sentences.english: Mr. Thaksin was ousted in a military coup in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 他信在2006年的一次軍事政變中被廢黜。

sentences.english: And disestablishment would be a very good thing.
sentences.chinese: 第二，廢黜英國國教應該會是一件極好的事情。

definition: first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Sima Yan (236-290), founding emperor of Jin dynasty 晋 after the Three Kingdoms period, reigned 265-290 as Emperor Wu of Jin 晉武帝
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee

Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]
Zhu Qizhen, personal name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3], afterwards Tianshun Emperor 天順|天顺[Tian1 shun4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449 and 1457-1464
Emperor Xian of Han (181-234), the final Han emperor, set up by Dong Zhuo 董卓, reigned 189-220, forced to abdicate 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕
Zhao Gao (?-207 BC), one of the most vile, corrupt and powerful eunuchs in Chinese history, responsible for the fall of Qin Dynasty
Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC
Jiangling county in Jingzhou 荊州|荆州[Jing1 zhou1], Hubei
